001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.persistence.io;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.buffer.BufferPools;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.buffer.PooledBufferedOutputStream;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.io.OutputStream;
007import java.nio.channels.Channels;
008import java.nio.channels.FileChannel;
009import java.nio.file.Path;
010import java.nio.file.StandardOpenOption;
011
012/**
013 * File-backed blob writer with pooled buffering to minimize allocation churn.
014 */
015public final class BlobWriter implements AutoCloseable {
016  private final FileChannel channel;
017  private final PooledBufferedOutputStream stream;
018  private long position;
019
020  /**
021   * Opens (or creates) a blob file, appending to the existing content if present.
022   *
023   * @param path target file path
024   * @throws IOException when the file cannot be opened for append
025   */
026  public BlobWriter(Path path) throws IOException {
027    this.channel =
028        FileChannel.open(
029            path,
030            StandardOpenOption.CREATE,
031            StandardOpenOption.WRITE,
032            StandardOpenOption.APPEND);
033    long size = channel.size();
034    channel.position(size);
035    this.position = size;
036    OutputStream out = Channels.newOutputStream(channel);
037    this.stream = new PooledBufferedOutputStream(out, BufferPools.ioBuffers());
038  }
039
040  /**
041   * Returns the current write position within the blob.
042   *
043   * @return byte offset for the next write
044   */
045  public long position() {
046    return position;
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Writes a slice of the provided array into the blob.
051   *
052   * @param data source buffer
053   * @param offset starting offset within {@code data}
054   * @param length number of bytes to write
055   * @throws IOException when the write fails
056   */
057  public void write(byte[] data, int offset, int length) throws IOException {
058    if (length <= 0) {
059      return;
060    }
061    stream.write(data, offset, length);
062    position += length;
063  }
064
065  /**
066   * Flushes buffered bytes to disk and optionally forces filesystem metadata.
067   *
068   * @param metadata when {@code true}, forces an fsync of metadata as well as data
069   * @throws IOException when the flush fails
070   */
071  public void flush(boolean metadata) throws IOException {
072    stream.flush();
073    channel.force(metadata);
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Flushes and releases all resources associated with this writer.
078   *
079   * @throws IOException when flushing or closing the underlying channel fails
080   */
081  @Override
082  public void close() throws IOException {
083    try {
084      stream.flush();
085      channel.force(true);
086    } finally {
087      stream.close();
088    }
089  }
090}
091
